A bakery sells 240 loaves of bread per day, and each loaf weighs 0.5 kg on average. if they want to package their bread in bags that hold 12 loaves each and weigh a total of exactly 18 kg, how many kilograms of space will be wasted in packaging?

You have 15 boxes of pens, and each box contains 24 pens. however, some of the pens are damaged and need to be replaced. the cost of replacing one pen is $0.05, while the cost of purchasing a new set of 25 pens is $3. how much would you save if you buy a new set instead of replacing individual pens?
Tom has five chickens, and each lays an average of 3 eggs per week. how many eggs does he have in total after six weeks?
Tom and alex have been saving money for a new bike, with tom contributing $x$ dollars per week and alex contributing $y$ dollars per week. if they save for 36 weeks, what is their total savings?

The wooden door frame of a shipping crate has a rectangular shape with a length of 4 meters and a width of $x$ meters. if the area of the inner space of the crate is $96 \text{ m}^2$, what is the value of $x$?

In a certain organization, there are three types of employees: a, b, and c. type a employees make up $40\%$ of the total workforce, type b employees make up $30\%$, and type c employees make up the remaining $30\%$. if there are 1200 employees in the organization, how many type c employees does the organization have?
The volume of a rectangular box with length $l$ and width $w$ is given by the formula $v = lwh$. if the volume is increased by 20%, what is the new volume?
A bakery sells boxes of cookies that contain $12$ cookies each. if the bakery packages $24$ cookies into boxes, how many boxes can be made with $\frac{5}{6}$ of a box?

A bakery sells a total of 240 loaves of bread per day. they sell more whole wheat and white bread than whole rye. if they make $\frac{2}{3}$ as many whole wheat breads as whole rye breads, and each loaf of whole wheat bread is $\$0.50$, and each loaf of white bread is $\$0.75$. how much money does the bakery make from whole wheat bread in one day?

Maria is planning a road trip from her hometown to a nearby city. the distance between the two cities is approximately $\log_{7}{2400}$ kilometers. if she drives at an average speed of 60 km/h, how many hours will it take her to complete the journey?
A bakery sells large quantities of bread in bulk packs of 5 loaves and 10 loaves. what is the least number of these bulk packs that must be purchased if at least 57 loaves of bread need to be bought?
In a certain game, players roll two six-sided dice and add up the numbers on the faces that land facing up. what must the value of $c$ be so that when one player rolls a total of 12, they win?

A teacher is preparing her lesson materials and has 264 pennies, nickels, dimes, and quarters in a jar. the number of coins of each type is in the same ratio as the number of letters in the words "teacher", "pennies", "nickels", "dimes", and "quarters". what is the smallest number of coins she could have?
In base 10, a three-digit number has the form xyza, where x, y, and z are digits (0-9). if the value of this number is divisible by 5, what is the possible values for the digit x?

Tom and alex have been saving money for a new video game that costs $240. they each saved an equal amount of money, but they found out how much each had after 3 months when they combined their savings to buy the game. if they spent \$48 on snacks during those three months, what is the amount each one saved in total?

A bakery sells three types of bread: whole wheat, white, and rye. on monday, they sold 240 loaves of whole wheat, 150 loaves of white, and 100 loaves of rye. if they make a profit of $0.50 per loaf of whole wheat, $0.40 per loaf of white, and $0.60 per loaf of rye, how much profit did the bakery make in total?

A bakery is having a sale on bread, offering a 15% discount on all loaves of whole wheat bread that weigh more than 2 pounds and cost less than $8. what is the amount of money saved if you buy 5 loaves of whole wheat bread at this price?
Tom has been saving money for a new bike and has $240 in his piggy bank. he wants to buy a bike that costs $180. what fraction of his savings is left after buying the bike?

A bakery sells 250 loaves of bread per day. if each loaf costs $2, and a baker takes $3 breaks during the day, with each break lasting for 10 minutes, how much money does the baker spend on total cost of living expenses per week?

A cylindrical can with radius $2$ inches has a height of $8$ inches. if water flows into the can at a rate that fills it in 24 minutes, what is the volume of water that enters the can during this time?

Tom is building a triangular roof and wants to cover it with square tiles that fit perfectly without gaps. the larger triangles formed by two adjacent tiles will be right-angled, and the smaller triangles (the ones under each tile) will also form right-angles at their vertices. what is the ratio of the area of the large triangle on top to the total area of the roof?

A bakery sells a certain number of loaves of bread per day. on monday, they sold x loaves. on tuesday, they doubled the quantity sold from monday and sold y loaves. if the bakery had previously sold z loaves in the first five days of the week, how many loaves did they sell during the entire week?
Tom has three boxes of pens worth $18 and $9. if he wants to spend exactly $36 on pens from these boxes, what is the largest possible value of one box of pens?
A water tank can hold 1200 liters of water. on tuesday, it was filled to 75% capacity. on wednesday, 25 gallons were drained. what percentage of the tank's capacity is left after wednesday?

Tom and his friends plan a road trip from city a to city b, which is 280 miles away. if they drive at a constant speed of 40 miles per hour for 4 hours, and then take a bus that travels at an average speed of 60 miles per hour for 3 more hours. what is the total time taken for the entire trip?
Tom has been saving money for a new bike and has $ab - 3a + 4b = 137$, where $a$ and $b$ are positive integers. what is the minimal possible value of $|a - b|$?

A school has three groups of students who have been assigned seats in alphabetical order. the average height of all the students in group a is 5 feet, the average height of all the students in group b is 6 feet, and the average height of all the students in group c is 7 feet. if the total number of students in each group is equal, what is the maximum possible value of the sum of the heights of the tallest student in group a, the shortest student in group b, and the shortest student in group c?
At a school bake sale, a tray of cookies costs $\$2$, and a tray of brownies costs $\$4$. a customer purchases 3 trays of each item. if she pays with a \$40 bill, how much change will she receive?

A bakery sells 250 loaves of bread per day. they have a special discount on tuesdays and thursdays, during which they sell only 180 loaves per day. the profit made from selling bread on those two days is \$$540. what is the profit made from selling bread on a normal day?
A rectangular prism has a length of $5$ meters, a width of $4$ meters, and a height of $8$ meters. the diagonal of the base is $\sqrt{41}$ meters long. find the area of the top surface.

You have 15 boxes in your closet that need to be packed with books. each book takes up half the space of one box, and you want each box to contain at most 6 books. how many books should you pack into the boxes so that all of them have an equal amount of empty space?
In a small town, the local bakery sells 250 loaves of bread per day on average. if each loaf weighs approximately 2 pounds and costs $3.50, what is the daily revenue of the bakery?

A company has a warehouse with shelves that can hold books in stacks of 12 books each. the warehouse has 5 shelves that are currently filled to capacity. how many more books can be placed on the empty shelves if the same number of books are added to each shelf?

Tom has been saving money for a new bike and has $120 in his piggy bank. he plans to add $x$ dollars to his savings account each week for 8 weeks. what is the total amount of money tom will have in his piggy bank after 8 weeks if he saves an additional amount equal to the amount he already has?

A bicycle manufacturer produces two types of bicycles: mountain bikes and road bikes. the number of mountain bikes produced is inversely proportional to the number of road bikes produced, with a constant of proportionality of 1200. if the manufacturer produced 400 mountain bikes last year, how many road bikes did it produce?
A circle has an equation of $(x-2)^2 + (y-4)^2 = r^2$ and a second circle has an equation of $(x+3)^2 + y^2 = r^2$. what is the distance between the centers of the circles?

Tom has been saving money for a new bike and has $480 in his piggy bank. he plans to add $15 per week for 10 weeks, then $20 per week for 5 more weeks. how much money will he have after 15 weeks if he doesn't spend any of it?

A bakery has a special promotion where they sell bread for $2 each or 3 loaves of bread for $6. if sara buys x number of individual loaves of bread and y number of sets of 3 loaves, how much will she pay in total?

Tom has three boxes of pens in his desk drawer. one box contains 15 black pens, one box contains 18 white pens, and one box contains 12 green pens. what is the probability that a randomly selected pen will be either blue or green?

Tom has been saving money for a new bike and has $\$120$in his savings account. he plans to add $\$30$ each month for the next $8$ months. if he buys the bike for$\$180$, how much did he get as change?
The area of a square garden measures 144 square yards. find the length of one side of the garden.
A company has two types of cars: sedans and suvs. the total number of cars produced was 4500, with 1200 being sedans and 3300 being suvs. what is the ratio of sedans to suvs?

A bakery sells a total of 480 muffins and cakes every day. if they sell twice as many muffins as cakes, and each muffin costs $2.50 and each cake costs $3.25, what is the total daily revenue from the sale of muffins and cakes?
A water tank can hold a certain number of gallons when full. if the tank is 30% full and contains 27 gallons less than when it is 20% empty, how many gallons does the tank hold in total?

Tom has been saving money for a new bike and has $120 in his savings account. he plans to add $15 each week for 8 weeks. how much money will he have in his account after 8 weeks if he decides to stop saving once he reaches his goal of having twice as much money as he had initially?

A bookshelf has an odd number of shelves, and each shelf can hold exactly two books. if the average weight of all the books on the shelves is 8 kg, what is the total weight of the heaviest and lightest books?
A cylindrical tank can hold 240 gallons of water. it takes 30 minutes for the tank to fill up completely. what is the volume of water flowing out per minute from a hole in the bottom of the tank?

A bakery sells a total of 240 loaves of bread every day, with 120 loaves being whole wheat and 120 loaves being white. if there is an equal ratio of whole wheat to white loaves sold in the morning and afternoon, how many loaves of each type are sold in a 12-hour period?

In a rectangular garden, a path that is 10 feet wide surrounds a rectangular area with dimensions 18 meters by 12 meters. find the area of the entire region including the path. (answer not provided)
A solar-powered radio transmitter sends a signal of 1050 meters every two minutes. how many signals does it send in five hours?

Tom's bakery sells large bags of flour that hold either 25 pounds or 50 pounds each. if tom needs to buy at least 100 pounds of flour for his recipe and he can afford to spend no more than $500, how much should he pay per pound if he buys 4 x 25-pound bags?

A bakery sells a total of 250 loaves of bread per day, and each loaf weighs an average of 0.4 kg. if they sell a combination of whole wheat and white bread in the same ratio as their annual sales (which was $450,000 units) last year, and it is known that the price difference between whole wheat and white bread is $\$2$, what is the total revenue generated from selling only whole wheat bread per week?
In base-10 number system, how many different ways can we select two digits to form a two-digit number with distinct digits such that the sum of the tens digit and the unit's digit is 9?

Tom has 5 boxes of pens that contain a total of 480 pens. if each box contains an equal number of pens, and the number of pens in each box is greater than or equal to 20, what is the maximum possible number of pens in each box?

An ice cream truck makes three trips around a circular track. each trip takes 30 minutes long. how many minutes will it take for the ice cream truck to make ten complete trips around the track if the driver spends 5 minutes at each stop along the way?

A freight train travels 1 mile in 1 minute 30 seconds. at this rate, how many miles will the train travel in 1 hour? the smiths' family is heading out on a road trip. they've been driving for 90 minutes, and their fuel gauge shows they have enough gas to make another 60 miles before running dry. how many miles per hour do they need to maintain a constant speed to reach their destination?

A bakery sells a total of 480 muffins and cupcakes combined. they sell 240 muffins on monday and tuesday, and 180 more on wednesday and thursday. if they sell an equal number of each type of baked good on friday and saturday, how many muffins do they sell per day on those two days?

Tom has been saving money for a new bike and has $240 in his savings account. he plans to add $x$ dollars each month, but he will stop saving when he has exactly $1000. how many months will it take him to reach his goal?

A bakery sells a certain type of bread that comes in standard sizes: 2 inches by 4 inches, 2 inches by 6 inches, 2 inches by 8 inches, and so on. what is the area of the rectangular region formed by connecting the midpoints of all possible rectangles made from these standard bread sizes?

A bakery sells a total of $x$ dozen cakes per day. they make a profit of $\frac{3}{4}$ of their cost on each cake. how much do they make from selling all the cakes sold during the first week, if they sold $48$ dozen cakes in that period?

Tom is planning a road trip from city a to city b, with a distance of 375 miles between them. he will drive at an average speed of 55 miles per hour. how many hours will it take him to complete his trip if he leaves on monday morning and arrives on wednesday afternoon?
An athlete scored a total of 225 points over two games. if she scored 25 more points in the first game than she did in the second game, what was her score in the second game?
Maria's school has 144 students, and she wants to put them into groups of four for a field trip. if two groups have 5 extra students each, how many groups can maria make in total?
Juan can speak five languages: english, spanish, french, german, and chinese. he spends one month learning each language. which month does he learn german?

Alex is constructing a rectangular garden in her backyard. the length of the garden is 15 meters, and she wants to add a path around it. if the width of the path is x meters, what is the minimum value of x such that the area of the entire design (path included) is at least 60 square meters?

At a bakery, the bakers make three types of bread: whole wheat, white, and rye. they sell them in bags of 12 slices each. a customer buys 3 times as many whole wheat as white bread and twice as many rye as whole wheat. how many different combinations of bag sizes can they fill with these breads if the total number of slices must be divisible by 4?

Rachel has been saving money for a new bike and has $120 in her savings account. she plans to put some of her money into a high-yield savings account that earns 4% interest per year. after one year, how much money will she have, rounded to the nearest cent?

A bakery sells a total of 250 loaves of bread daily. they make $0.50 profit per loaf for whole wheat bread and $0.75 profit per loaf for rye bread. how much profit do they make on a typical day if most of their sales come from whole wheat bread?

Tom has been saving money for a new bike and has $4x-3$ dollars after spending $x$ dollars on a toy. how much more money does he have before buying the bike? write an inequality to represent this situation.

A water tank has a capacity of $1200$ gallons, and it is being filled at a rate of $10$ gallons per minute. at the same time, $5$ gallons of water are leaking out every 6 minutes. how many minutes will it take to fill the tank?
A car rental agency charges a base fee of $40 plus an additional $0.25 for each mile driven. if sarah rented a car for $60, what was her total mileage?
Find the volume of a cube if one edge measures 8 centimeters and the length of its diagonal is 14 centimeters.
A school bus can travel 250 miles in 5 hours. how many miles per hour is the average speed of the bus?

A bakery sells a total of 250 loaves of bread per day. they make $0.50 profit on each whole wheat loaf and $0.75 profit on each white bread loaf. if they use 4/5 as much flour to make white bread as they do to make whole wheat bread, how much more does the bakery make in profit from selling white bread than from selling whole wheat bread?

A dance troupe has 15 members, and they want to schedule a concert in a hall that can accommodate at least 210 people. if the hall has a seating capacity of 240 seats but also requires an aisle for every 40 attendees, how many rows should the troupe arrange the chairs?

Maria invested $\$ 4500$in bonds that pay interest compounded annually. she earns an annual rate of $ r\%$. after 5 years, she will have a total of $\$ x .$ what is the value of $x$ if she invests half of her money in each type of bond?
Rachel has been saving money for a new bike and has \($150$, which she plans to put into a savings account that earns 8$\%$ interest per year. how much more than\($100\) will she have after one year?

A theater has two seats, one located on either side of a door that is 3 feet wide. if the distance from the back of the front seat to the back of the rear seat is 6 feet and the distance from the back of the front seat to the floor is 5 feet, what is the total height of both seats?

A bakery sells $3$ types of bread: whole wheat, white, and rye. the ratio of whole wheat to white bread is $7:15$. how many more loaves of rye bread are sold than whole wheat bread if $105$ loaves were sold in total?
In base-4 number system, find the sum of $133_4$ and $302_4$.

Find all the solutions to \[\sqrt{(2 + \sqrt{3})^x} + \sqrt{(2 - \sqrt{3})^x} = 4.\] this is not a typical problem that can be solved using simple arithmetic operations. however, after some manipulation and analysis, we can arrive at the solution x=2.
Calculate: $9-8+7\times6+5-4\times3+2-1$ first, perform multiplication $9-8+42+5-12+2-1=37$
A company has two types of cars: sedan and suvs. sedans account for 60% of all vehicles in their inventory. if there are 150 sedans in stock, how many suvs are there?
A bakery sells 480 loaves of bread per day, and each loaf is wrapped in a unique colored paper that comes in sets of 12. how many complete sets can be made from the papers used to wrap 3600 loaves?

A park has three large rocks, one located at an elevation of $50$ meters above sea level, another $30$ meters below sea level, and a third rock that is 100 meters vertically aligned with the first one but on the opposite side of the ocean. what is the minimum distance between any two of the rocks?

A bakery sells a total of $2400$ loaves of bread in a day. they have different types of bread with varying prices. the cheapest type costs $0.70 per loaf, while the most expensive type costs $2.25 per loaf. how many loaves of each type were sold if the total revenue from all types was $5400?

A bakery sells a total of 250 loaves of bread per day, with a mix of white and whole wheat bread. the ratio of white bread to whole wheat bread is 3:5. if the bakery has been in operation for 15 days, how many loaves of white bread does it sell on average per day?

A bookshelf has 5 shelves, and each shelf can hold an unlimited number of books. if the first shelf holds x books, the second shelf holds 3x books, the third shelf holds 2x^2 + 5 books, and so on. what is the total number of books that the bookshelf can hold?

Tom has $\frac{3}{5}$ of a pizza that he baked for his family dinner, and sarah has $\frac{2}{7}$ of a large pizza from the store. if they ate $6$ slices in total, how many slices did each person get?

In an online course with 240 students, 30% of them have taken three courses, 20% have taken two courses, and 50% have taken only one course. what is the number of students who have taken at least one course?

Tom has been saving money for a new bike and has $240 in his savings account. he wants to buy a bike that costs $420. his parents have agreed to give him an allowance of $15 per week for doing chores. however, they also plan to deduct $5 from his weekly allowance if he doesn't meet his homework assignments. if tom normally does about 6 chores per week, how much more will he need to do per week to earn enough money to buy the bike?
An investment yields a 12% annual return on its principal amount. if you invest $2000 for 5 years, approximately how much money will you have after 5 years?
In a bakery, they sell cupcakes in boxes of 8 or 12. if a customer buys exactly 48 cupcakes, how many different ways can they pack them into boxes?
If a bakery sells $240$ loaves of bread per day at $2.50 each, how much money does the bakery make in total if it operates from 8am to 10pm, which is 14 hours?

A school has a total of 21 students in three classes, and their average age is 12 years. if one class has 5 more students than the other two classes combined, what is the sum of the ages of all the students?
Expand the expression (3x^2 + 2xy - x) * (2x + y).

If a company sells x units of product a, y units of product b, and z units of product c in three consecutive years, and the total sales for those three years is $1500x + 200y - 300z$, what is the value of x + y + z?
At a certain store, each item costs $2x + 5$ dollars. if the profit on an item is the selling price minus the cost, and the profit is 12 dollars, what is the value of x?
A rectangle with a length of 10 cm and a width of 5 cm has a rectangular garden in it. the area of the garden can be expressed as a product of two numbers whose sum is 10. what are these two numbers?
